image.altText: Patients being treated at the Royal Melbourne Hospital road trauma unit.

props.synopsis: Last year was the deadliest on Australia's roads in five years, but there's no national record of how many people were left injured.

title.children: In one of Australia's busiest trauma hospitals, the phone is ringing, a helicopter is landing and surgery is about to begin

image.altText: Five Israeli soldiers walk around a dirt field.

props.synopsis: Israel's military actions in Gaza are acts of self-defence against Hamas and "other terrorist organisations", the legal advisor for Israel's foreign ministry says at the opening of the second day of hearings at the World Court.

title.children: Israel rejects claims of genocide levelled in UN's top court

image.altText: Woman in winter-wear running on snow with ice-capped mountain in background and clear blue sky

props.synopsis: She'd spent two years preparing – hoping to set a new world record for the longest polar run ever completed – but still, nothing could prepare her for the real thing.

title.children: Melbourne woman who ran 1,300km across Antarctica, says there were 'a lot of tears'

image.altText: Protesters burning flags.

props.synopsis: Yemen's Houthi rebels vow fierce retaliation for US and British strikes against them, further raising the prospect of a wider conflict in a region already beset by Israel's war in Gaza.

title.children: Houthi rebels vow fierce retaliation after US and British strikes against them

props.synopsis: Regional Victorians were still dealing with the effects of the October 2022 floods when the latest weather events rolled through, adding to the damage.

title.children: Residents flooded in regional Victoria say fast-paced housing development is making water flow worse

image.altText: The stage of a music festival

props.synopsis: A woman is in a critical condition after a suspected drug overdose, with two men arrested for drug offences at Juicy Fest on Friday night.

title.children: Melbourne music festival marred by suspected overdose and drug arrests

image.altText: A jet aircraft shoots across the flight deck of an aircraft carrier at night.

props.synopsis: There has been a diplomatic dance going on as the West backs Israel and Iran uses its proxies across the region, but now Western superpowers have jets in the sky.

title.children: There has been a proxy war playing out, but now the UK and US have jets in the sky

image.altText: A woman with light brown hair looks close to tears.

props.synopsis: Former prime minister Scott Morrison's press secretary made an angry phone call to a Network Ten news executive after it aired an interview between Brittany Higgins and journalist Lisa Wilkinson, court documents have revealed.

title.children: Court documents detail expletive-ridden call from PM's office to Network Ten over interview with Brittany Higgins

image.altText: Two purple, concentric circles with a red line passing through it.

props.synopsis: Astronomers have discovered a surprising "signal" from outside of our galaxy after analysing 13 years of data from NASA's Fermi Gamma-ray Space Telescope.

title.children: NASA astronomers detect high-energy 'signal' from outside our galaxy in 'serendipitous discovery'

props.synopsis: The Australian Open might call Melbourne Park home now, but nearly every state capital has hosted the Asia Pacific's grand slam at some stage, as well as two cities in New Zealand. But there's not been any venue more unusual than Perth Zoo.

title.children: The Australian Open is one of tennis's most loved tournaments, with a spectacular home — but it was once played in a zoo

image.altText: a man stands in front of a ute and caravan

props.synopsis: As the owner of a caravan weighing business, Jarrod Dickinson is meticulous about packing light to meet the country's strict towing load limits, but he says most caravan owners turn a blind eye to the rules.

title.children: Industry says two-thirds of caravans are illegally overweight, uninsured and dangerous

image.altText: Soldiers with an MNDAA flag pose for a photo in front of a bridge.

props.synopsis: Myanmar's military reaches a ceasefire agreement with an alliance of ethnic minority guerilla groups it has been battling in the country's north-east.

title.children: Myanmar rebel alliance agrees to ceasefire with ruling military

image.altText: Full photo of Farquharson family grave, taken from one side.

props.synopsis: Robert Farquharson, who killed his three sons, is the first convicted killer or serious criminal to have his rights to control the graves of his children taken away.

title.children: Killer Robert Farquharson's name has been chiselled off his sons' graves. Now he's lost the right to control them

image.altText: Black and white grainy photo of women in long white dresses and aprons folding sheets in a large room.

props.synopsis: In the 19th century, Australia was home to Magdalene "retreats", Catholic-run institutions to reform wayward women. For some, the path to penitence was a brutal one.

title.children: Why sex workers and unmarried women worked for no pay at these commercial laundries

image.altText: A composite image shows three black and white portraits of women side by side, wearing jewellery and crowns

props.synopsis: From an alleged poisoning plot to uprooted royals on the run and a secret romance that divided a family, these are just a few accounts of Australia's royal encounters.

title.children: Before the rise of Queen Mary, another Sydney girl spent her life as a wandering queen in exile

image.altText: A boy with a hat on, smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Northern Territory boy Tristan Frank was last seen near Balgo in outback Western Australia in 2020. He hasn't been seen since.

title.children: Coroner hears scant details of why 14yo boy Tristan Frank has been missing for three years without a trace

image.altText: David Warner walking away from a helicopter that delivered him to the Sydney Cricket Ground for a Sydney Thunder BBL game.

props.synopsis: Less than a week after his Test farewell at the Sydney Cricket Ground, David Warner was touching down on the hallowed turf after a hasty helicopter ride from his brother's wedding.

title.children: David Warner arrives via helicopter for Big Bash game at SCG

image.altText: A barista makes a coffee on a machine at a cafe

props.synopsis: The laws around the minimum age Australian kids can work are notoriously rubbery and, as any young worker will tell you, inconsistent or thoughtless laws leave young people vulnerable and open to exploitation, like I was, writes Virginia Trioli.

title.children: As a naïve teenager I learned the perks and pitfalls of paid work. I lost count of the times I was taken advantage of

image.altText: A woman's hand holds two large white satchels with "The Iconic" written on the front in black.

props.synopsis: Some of The Iconic's customers have been caught out by the aftershocks of a "credential stuffing" attack, but a cybersecurity expert says common shortcuts have put shoppers at greater risk without them knowing.

title.children: Typing in your details when shopping online might be a pain, but cybersecurity experts say it's a small price to pay

image.altText: Maria Ressa gestures after she was acquitted of the tax evasion cases against her

props.synopsis: Human Rights Watch warns of an authoritarian slide across the region in its latest annual world report. Still, there were several milestones in 2023, particularly across LGBT rights and same-sex marriage.

title.children: Human Rights Watch world report: Five milestones you may have missed in Asia

image.altText: A  smiling woman holds her little daughter in a snowsuit as her squat on snowy mountains.

props.synopsis: At a time when most toddlers are just getting the hang of walking, 18-month-olf Lucy Brown has staked her claim as the youngest person to reach the Mount Everest base camp.

title.children: Perth toddler continues family legacy of record-setting Mount Everest climbs

image.altText: Two unidentified officers look out from the bridge of the ship

props.synopsis: A Houthi official says raids have been conducted in several Yemeni cities, including the capital Sana'a, with a US official saying strikes against the Iran-backed group were carried out by air and sea.

title.children: Deputy PM confirms Australia is providing support in US and British strikes against Houthi targets in Yemen

image.altText: Three people hold brooms as they sweep debris off the ground in front of a store.

props.synopsis: The national death toll from violent riots in Papua New Guinea has climbed to 22, with the remains of six people found in Port Moresby today.

title.children: Discovery of six bodies lifts death toll in PNG riots to 22

image.altText: James Marape and members of his government

props.synopsis: Social and political tensions were rising across Papua New Guinea, then police went on strike and the streets ignited with deadly unrest, but the prime minister is claiming it was "political influence" that lit the match.

title.children: When the PNG PM appeared with 26 colleagues by his side, there was a clear message

image.altText: A dingo sits on a sanddune

props.synopsis: The primary school-aged girl is in Gympie Hospital with multiple lacerations after being bitten by a dingo on her leg, the second attack recorded on the heritage-listed island this year.

title.children: Dingo bites young girl on the leg at K'gari (Fraser Island) in second attack for 2024

image.altText: Man smiling

props.synopsis: The family of a man shot dead by police in New South Wales say they understand the actions taken by officers, but the incident exposes a failure within the systems designed to support people with mental illness.

title.children: Family of man shot by police in Nowra say mental health system failure contributed to his death

image.altText: Wanted man Brisbane

props.synopsis: Police say the 30-year-old man is a potential risk to the community and is wanted in relation to "a number of weapon and criminal offences".

title.children: Police seek urgent assistance to find potentially 'armed, dangerous' man in Brisbane

image.altText: A ruin of white timber fence paneling strewn across a lawn.

props.synopsis: A Glengarry family were lucky to be away from home when a truck negotiating a sweeping bend tipped and spilled logs into their yard and home.

title.children: Trail of destruction as Tasmanian log truck tips, spilling logs into home

image.altText: A crowd gathers outside a gate while several people try to break through the gate

props.synopsis: Sixteen people have died in violent riots in Papua New Guinea after some residents took advantage of police being on strike to set shops and businesses alight in the capital. The PM has now declared a state of emergency for 14 days.

title.children: State of emergency declared in Papua New Guinea with defence personnel on standby to stop further violence

image.altText: A man hold a red chicken with green trees behind him, he has short grey hair and smiles

props.synopsis: High egg prices are set to get higher as farmers pay more for feed and infrastructure, but a supermarket manager is confident grocery prices will soon plateau as inflation settles down.

title.children: Egg farmer warns rising production costs will force another price hike in supermarkets

image.altText: Six people stand in front of a fence with a wide river in the background.

props.synopsis: Making meaningful connections and forming friendships after relocating to a regional area can seem like a daunting task. Here are some tips to make the process less intimidating from people who have done it.

title.children: Advice on how to meet like-minded people and forge friendships after moving to a regional town

image.altText: A woman stands smiling in a shirt that says worlds ugliest lawn. Her lawn has patches of grass, dirt and holes dugs by wildlife.

props.synopsis: Kathleen Murray's journey to claiming the World's Ugliest Lawn began in 2016 — when her ex took the lawnmower and some bandicoots decided to make it their own personal Disneyland.

title.children: Tasmanian winner of 'World's Ugliest Lawn' competition says her ex left with the mower

image.altText: An aerial shot of a flooded caravan park

props.synopsis: As Shepparton locals wait anxiously to see how high the Goulburn River will peak, other communities have started the process of recovering from flooding and are calling on tourists to reconsider cancelling any visits.

title.children: Calls for tourism support as floodwaters recede in parts of Victoria and Shepparton residents await peak river level

image.altText: A burnt car in a shopfront.

props.synopsis: A tobacco store in Altona has been targeted for a second consecutive night. Police are investigating whether the incidents are linked to Melbourne's tobacco turf wars.

title.children: Tobacco store rammed and set alight in Melbourne's west

image.altText: Nectarines sitting on the ground in a puddle of dirty water.

props.synopsis: Weeks of wild weather in Victoria is likely to mean less stone fruit on supermarket shelves, after hail and heavy rain smashed Australia's main production regions, costing growers millions of dollars in losses.

title.children: Supply of plums, peaches and nectarines in doubt as storms ravage stone-fruit orchards
